@NatGeoTravelUK Also, in Zambia saw a lioness with a one week old cub. She dropped the cub on the ground & went off to nap. Cub stumbled around crying & crying for its mom for the longest time. Saddest thing Iâ€™ve seen on safari. ðŸ™ #NGTUK

@NatGeoTravelUK In Kenya, watched a pride of lions devouring a wildebeest when a family of elephants came up and charged at them, scaring them away. Lions slowly returned, only to be spooked again. Eventually the ellies left & lions finished their meal #NGTUK

I was 8 when Sixteen Candles came out. Not sure how old I was when I saw it for the first time, but it was certainly before I was in high school.
And of course it all ends with Jake magically showing up & whisking Samantha away after nothing more than a few stares at school, creating unrealistic expectations for us all...
And then Jake says "I have Carolyn passed out upstairs right now. I could violate her 10 different ways if I wanted to." HOW WAS THIS OK?!?
Like when the geek tries to hit on Sam multiple times, she pushes him off and somehow ends up apologizing to him...
Watching Sixteen Candles in today's context and wow, is it awful.
So many Hamilton lyrics keep running through my head...
